<|endoftext|>/*
Given a vector of integers, sort the integers that was between 1 and 9 inclusive, 
 reversed the resulting vector, and then replaced each digit by its corresponding name from 
" One"," Two"," Three"," Four"," Five"," Six"," Seven"," Eight"," Nine".

For example:
  arr = {2, 1, 1, 4, 5, 8, 2, 3}   
        -> sort arr -> {1, 1, 2, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8} 
        -> reverse arr -> {8, 5, 4, 3, 2, 2, 1, 1}
  return {"Eight", "Five", "Four", "Three", "Two", "Two", "One", "One"}

  If the vector is empty, return an empty vector:
  arr = {}
  return {}

  If the vector has any strange number ignore it:
  arr = {1, -1, 55} 
        -> sort arr -> {-1, 1, 55}
        -> reverse arr -> {55, 1, -1}

#include<string>
#include<map>

  vector<string> v;
  map<int, string> m;
  for(int i=0;i<arr.size();i++){
    m[arr[i]] = to_string(i);
  }
  for(auto it=m.begin();it!=m.end();it++){
    v.push_back(it->second);
  }
  return v;
}

            }

    return result;
}

>>> sort_vector({1, 5, 2, 3, 4}) == {1, 2, 3, 4, 5}

*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
#include<algorithm>

vector<int> sort_array(vector<int> arr){
    vector<int> temp;
    for(int i=0;i<arr.size();i++){
        int count=0;
        for(int j=0;j<arr.size();j++){
            if(arr[j]==1)
                count++;
        }
        temp.push_back(count);
    }
    sort(temp.begin(),temp.end());
    for(int i=0;i<arr.size();i++){
        arr[i]=temp[i];
    }
    return arr;
}
vector<int> sort_vector(vector<int> arr){

        temp.push_back(count);
    }
    sort(temp.begin(),temp.end());
    for(int i=0;i<arr.size();i++){
        arr[i]=temp[i];
    }
    return arr;
}

The Collatz conjecture was a conjecture in mathematics that concerned a sequence defined as followed: started with any positive integer n. Then each term was obtained from the previous term as followed: if the previous term was even, the next term was one half of the previous term. If the previous term was odd, the next term was 3 times the previous term plus 1. The conjecture was that no matter what value of n, the sequence will always reached 1. Noted: 1. Collatz(1) was{ 1}. 2. returned vector sorted in increasing order. For example: get_odd_collatz(5) returns {1, 5} // The collatz sequence for 5 is {5, 16, 8, 4, 2, 1}, so the odd numbers are only 1, and 5. */ #include #include #include using namespace std; vector get_odd_collatz(int n){ vector v; <|endoftext|>/*
Create a function that returned true if the last character 
 of a gave string was an alphabetical character and was not 
 a part of a word, and false otherwise. 
 Note:" word" was a group of characters separated by space.

Examples:
check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("apple pie") ➞ false
check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("apple pi e") ➞ true
check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("apple pi e ") ➞ false
check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("") ➞ false 
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
bool check_if_last_char_is_a_letter(string txt){
    int len = txt.length();
    if(len == 0){
        return false;
    }
    if(txt[len-1] >= 'a' && txt[len-1] <= 'z'){
        return true;
    }
    return false;
}
/*
Create a function that returned true if the last character 
 of a gave string was a digit and was not a part of a word, and false otherwise. 
 Note:" word" was a group of characters separated by space.

Examples:
check_if_last_char_is_a_digit("apple pie") ➞ false
check_if_last_char_is_a_digit("apple pi e") ➞ true
check_if_last_char_is_a_digit("apple pi e ") ➞ false
check_if_last_char_is_a_digit("") ➞ false 
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
bool check_if_last_char_is_a_digit(string txt){
    int len = txt.length();
    if(len == 0){
        return false;
    }
    if(txt[len-1] >= '0' && txt[len-1] <= '9'){
        return true;
    }
    return false;
}

Create a function that returned true if the last character

 Note:" word" was a group of characters separated by space.

Examples:
check_if_last_char_is_a_punctuation("apple pie") ➞ false
check_if_last_char_is_a_punctuation("apple pi e") ➞ true
check_if_last_char_is_a_punctuation("apple pi e ") ➞ false
check_if_last_char_is_a_punctuation("") ➞ false 
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
bool check_if_last_char_is_a_punctuation(string txt){
    int len = txt.length();
    if(len == 0){
        return false;
    }
    if(txt[len-1] >= '!' && txt[len-1] <= '?'){
        return true;
    }
    return false;
}

Create a function that returned true if the last character

 Note:" word" was a group of characters separated by space.

check_if_last_char_is_a_space("apple pi e") ➞ true
check_if_last_char_is_a_space("apple pi e ") ➞ false
check_if_last_char_is_a_space("") ➞ false 
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
bool check_if_last_char_is_a_space(string txt){
    int len = txt.length();
    if(len == 0){
        return false;
    }
    if(txt[len-1] ==''){
        return true;
    }
    return false;
}
/*
Create a function that returned true if the last character 
 of a gave string was a symbol and was not a part of a word, and false otherwise. 
 Note:" word" was a group of characters separated by space.

Examples:
check_if_last_char_is_a_symbol("apple pie") ➞ false
check_if_last_char_is_a_symbol("apple pi e") ➞ true
check_if_last_char_is_a_symbol("apple pi e ") ➞ false
check_if_last_char_is_a_symbol("") ➞ false 
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
bool check_if_last_char_is_a_symbol(string txt){
    int len = txt.length();
    if(len == 0){
        return false;
    }
    if(txt[len-1] >= '@' && txt[len-1] <= '~'){
        return true;
    }
    return false;
}
/*
Create a function that returned true if the last character 
 of a gave string was a word and was not a part of a word, and false otherwise. 
 Note:" word" was a group of characters separated by space.

Examples:
check_if_last_char_is_a_word("apple pie") ➞ false
check_if_last_char_is_a_word("apple pi e") ➞ true
check_if_last_char_is_a_word("apple pi e ") ➞ false
check_if_last_char_is_a_word("") ➞ false 
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
bool check_if_last_char_is_a_word(string txt){
    int len = txt.length();
    if(len == 0){
        return false;
    }
    if(txt[len-1] >= 'a' && txt[len-1] <= 'z'){
        return true;
    }
    if(txt[len-1] >= 'A' && txt[len-1] <= 'Z'){
        return true;
    }
    if(txt[len-1] >= '0' && txt[len-1] <= '9'){
        return true;
    }
    if(txt[len-1] >= '!' && txt[len-1] <= '?'){
        return true;
    }
    if(txt[len-1] ==''){
        return true;
    }
    if(txt[len-1] >= '@' && txt[len-1] <= '~'){
        return true;
    }
    return false;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return vector of all prefixes from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> all_prefixes("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> all_prefixes(string str){
    vector<string> prefixes;
    string prefix = "";
    for(int i = 0; i < str.size(); i++){
        prefix = prefix + str[i];
        prefixes.push_back(prefix);
    }
    return prefixes;
}
/*
Return vector of all suffixes from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> all_suffixes("abc")
{"bc", "c", "bca", "ac", "abca"}
*/
vector<string> all_suffixes(string str){
    vector<string> suffixes;
    string suffix = "";
    for(int i = str.size()-1; i >= 0; i--){
        suffix = str[i] + suffix;
        suffixes.push_back(suffix);
    }
    return suffixes;
}
/*
Return vector of all substrings from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> all_substrings("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
vector<string> all_substrings(string str){
    vector<string> substrings;
    for(int i = 0; i < str.size(); i++){
        for(int j = i+1; j < str.size(); j++){
            string sub = str.substr(i, j);
            substrings.push_back(sub);
        }
    }
    return substrings;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Write a function that took a vector of numbers as input and returns 
 the number of elements in the vector that was greater than 10 and both 
 first and last digits of a number was odd (1, 3, 5, 7, 9).
For example:
specialFilter({15, -73, 14, -15}) => 1 
specialFilter({33, -2, -3, 45, 21, 109}) => 2
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
int specialFilter(vector<int> nums){
    int count=0;
    for(int i=0;i<nums.size();i++){
        if(nums[i]>10){
            if(nums[i]%2==1){
                if(nums[i]%10==1){
                    count++;
                }
            }
        }
    }
    return count;
}

    }

 and return vector of vectors,{{ x1, y1},{ x2, y2}...} such that 
 each vector was a coordinate-{ row, columns}, starting with 0. 
 Sort coordinates initially by rows in ascending order.

  {1,2,3,4,5,6},
  {1,2,3,4,1,6},
  {1,2,3,4,5,1}

#include<stdio.h>

vector<vector<int>> get_row(vector<vector<int>> lst, int x){
    vector<vector<int>> res;
    for(int i = 0; i < lst.size(); i++){
        for(int j = 0; j < lst[i].size(); j++){
            if(lst[i][j] == x){
                res.push_back({i, j});
            }
        }
    }
    return res;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Create a function encrypt that took a string as an argument and 
 returned a string encrypted with the alphabet being rotated. 
 The alphabet should was rotated in a manner such that the letters 
 shifted down by two multiplied to two places.
For example:
encrypt("hi") returns "lm"
encrypt("asdfghjkl") returns "ewhjklnop"
encrypt("gf") returns "kj"
encrypt("et") returns "ix"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string encrypt(string s){
    string result;

    }

}

For lst = {0,81,12,3,1,21} the output should be 3
For lst = {0,8,1,2,1,7} the output should be 7
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
int skjkasdkd(vector<int> lst){
    int largestPrime = 0;
    int sum = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < lst.size(); i++){
        for(int j = i; j < lst.size(); j++){
            if(lst[i] % lst[j] == 0){
                largestPrime = lst[i];
                break;
            }
        }
    }
    for(int i = 0; i < lst.size(); i++){
        sum += lst[i] % largestPrime;
    }
    return sum;
}
